string.text: Da vajny Onin sychod vučnia abłohavaj spravy da inšaha majstra aznačaŭ vielmi balučuju śmierć u vypadku jaho viartańnia da majstra praz pałanieńnie. Ale časy źmianilisia. Najbahaciejšyja zamki Japonii pali, zaraz ich mury stali vyšej, čym niekali. Vaładary Sajkajaŭ płaciać mieniej abłohavym majstram, i hety zarobak časta zatrymvajecca. Tamu ja hatovy uziacca za novuju pracu, kali jaje prapanujuć.

Moj baćka byŭ adnym z tych, kaho Asikaha Jositeru navučaŭ u pałonnych inžynieraŭ. U tyja časy našy ludzi mała viedali pra abłohavuju spravu. Jamu nie dazvalali pracavać ni na koha, aproč Siohuna Asikaha, inačaj jaho b zabili samaj niepryjemnaj čynam. Ale jon navučyŭ mianie, svajho syna, svaim viedam, i ŭ ciapierašnim pakaleńni da hetaha stali stavicca spahadniej. Tamu ja mahu pracavać na kaho zachaču.
Viedajecie, lha padumać, što tut padajuć sapraŭdnaje sake, a nie hetuju maču... Prabačcie, na čym my spynilisia? Ach tak, maja historyja.

Ja šmat hadoŭ jeździŭ za Rudzodzi Takanobu. Ja mieŭ dobruju reputacyja i prystojnyja hrošy. U susiedniaj vioscy žyła dziaŭčyna, cichaja, ale z dobrymi ściohnami, zdolnymi da naradžennia, jakaja, jak ja dumaŭ, stanie dobraj niaviestaj.

Ja pajšoŭ da jaje brata i prapanavaŭ jamu 20 koniej – dobraja cana. Ale jon skazaŭ, što nie addaść svaju siastru za takoha čałavieka, jak ja. Ja spytaŭ jaho, što jon maje na ŭvazie, ale jon nie adkazaŭ, i ja daŭ jamu jak śled. Moža, paru ŭdaraŭ – nia bolš. Sapraŭdnamu mužčynu heta nie pavinna było naškodzić, ale hety ščaniuk pamior u mianie na rukach.

Ja hadami jeździŭ pad sciaham Rudzodzi Takanobu. Mnie varta było b zaniać hanarovaje miesca pry jaho pałacy. Ale ja zabiŭ čałavieka z bahaciejšaha kłana za abrazu, a toj mieŭ zašmat svajakoŭ, kab ja moh dalej zatrymlivacca.
Ja rodam z adnaho hornaha kłanu, što žyvie na krajniaj poŭnačy. Nia viedaju, ci znajomyja vy ź ich zvyčajami. Pasprabuju vytłumačyć.
Tak... Ja raskažu vam historyju pra žyćcio ŭ vialikaj Tumiedzkaj ardzie, što navodzić žach na ŭvieś śviet.
Ja biŭsia za Ałtan Chana. Ale pieššu - maja siamja z horada, a nie stepu. Žyćcio troški inšaje dla nas.
Im a soldier by trade. Ive served in the Amagos army for 20 years. Once upon a time they were worthy of respect. I served them for years, but war was not kind to them.

But Amago Yoshihisa led the army into a failed siege defense at Gassantoda Castle. You may have heard that story. I was laid up sick at the time. But a lot of my comrades didnt come back, and things were never the same afterward.
After the siege, The Amago were forced to a small island in northern Sanyo, with no hope of reconquering their lands.

I was a solider in the Amago army. How we came to this sorry state is a sad tale that youve no doubt heard already from my comrades. But Im sure youre familiar with our mettle in battle, and our skill at turning youths into soldiers.

Then I joined the Sakai, mercenaries. They spent most of their time using guns. Ha! Me, Id wade into the midst of the enemy, dealing out death right and left - and, well, all they had to say afterward was Why didnt you keep ranks?

Started in the Ashigaru. I found that I was the only real warrior among them. They were all about marching here and there in their pretty uniforms, not pulling sword from scabbard for months on end. I told them what I thought, and my captain told me to keep my mouth shut or leave. So I left.
Has no one told you that leaving a gap in a formation is as good as treason?

Let me tell you friend, Im hard. Ive fought as an ashigaru, then with the Sakai, any mercenaries worth their salt, Ive been with them. Others may tell youve theyve done what Ive done, but Im the real thing.
Bandits took me when I was a girl. I learned to fight with them as I grew, and did quite well with them.
Perhaps it was my destiny to become like this, a warrior with who enjoys slaughtering. Most men cant handle my presence.
I feel no guilt, no remorse. I kill when it is necessary, and dont ask questions.
You seem somewhat unhealthy.
Theres not much more to say. Im good at what I do, and ill follow orders. So here I am, looking to make a living through the only means I know - shedding other peoples blood. Got work?
I was raised by bandits where I learned to fight. I enjoy killing and wish to do it as much as possible.

Because I loved my mother, and because I was faster and stronger than the boys, I did all that she said I would do. Of those born in my year, I was the first to kill an enemy. My mother boasted even more, so that the other women came to hate her. They turned us all out of our encampment. We were forced to sell our lands, as we could not take them with us, and we were given but a fraction of the price. All we had was our horses. Of course raiders found us soon enough, and killed my mother, and took our horses. I escaped.
I wandered a bit around Japan. I starved a bit. But I followed the raiders and one, when he went beyond the campfire to empty his bladder, did not return. I now have his purse and his sword.
Every day, I give thanks to the Heavens that I was not born to that life.

I was the brat of a caravan guard. Never knew my mother, but my Da kept me close. I grew up running between the legs of horses on the roads, eavesdropping on merchant gossip in the cities, eating mochi cakes bought me by the other guards. A happier childhood you couldnt imagine.
So here I am. Guess Im not so interested in the marriage part, but I like the denars and I like my freedom. Maybe some day Ill surprise my Da with a nice farm to keep him happy in his old age.

I was the child of a caravan guard. I spent my babyhood swinging from a sling on the side of a horse, and my childhood chasing strays. But caravans are preyed upon by bandits and others, and I decided I dont like being prey. I reckon I have the skills to be a predator.
Im a surgeon. I trained at the imperial academy in Kyoto. I had many rich and influential patients in the town. I thought I was well shielded from the intrigues and dangers of the imperial Court.

But one day I was contacted by an agent of the Emperor. I do not know how well you know them. At first they wanted small harmless details about my patients. To do so was a violation of my oath, but I was anxious to have the favor of the Emperor. But soon they began to call on me for more and more.

There was a woman who lived out on the street. Refugee from the wars. Had a small child, a baby really. It was all she had. Shed make small cakes of rice over a fire. Then one day a young man from the palace came down the street in his horse. Wasnt looking where he was going, didnt care, and his horse crushed that babys head.
I feel no guilt, no remorse. I kill when it is necessary, and dont ask questions.
